This is a document with several edge cases to test robustness:

1. MALFORMED ENTITIES:
   - Names with unusual characters: JosÃ© MarÃ­a GutiÃ©rrez-SÃ¡nchez
   - Companies with special symbols: AT&T, Johnson & Johnson, Ben & Jerry's
   - URLs with edge cases: https://example.com/path?param=value&other=123
   - Emails with + symbols: john.doe+test@example.com
   - International phone: +1-555-123-4567, +44 20 7946 0958

2. FORMATTING ISSUES:
   ALL CAPS COMPANY: MICROSOFT CORPORATION
   all lowercase person: john smith from stanford university
   MiXeD cAsE: ThE qUiCk BrOwN fOx

3. AMBIGUOUS ENTITIES:
   - Apple (could be company or fruit)
   - Washington (person, state, or city?)
   - Mercury (planet, element, or company?)
   - Oracle (company or concept?)

4. OVERLAPPING ENTITIES:
   New York University in New York, New York
   Microsoft Office at Microsoft Corporation
   The University of California, Berkeley campus

5. NUMERIC CHALLENGES:
   - Large numbers: 1,234,567,890
   - Scientific notation: 1.23e-05
   - Percentages: 45.67%
   - Currency: $1,234.56, â‚¬987.65, Â¥12,345
   - Dates in various formats: 2024-10-15, 10/15/2024, October 15th, 2024

6. MULTILINGUAL CONTENT:
   - Spanish: Universidad Nacional AutÃ³noma de MÃ©xico
   - French: Ã‰cole Polytechnique FÃ©dÃ©rale de Lausanne  
   - German: Max-Planck-Institut fÃ¼r Informatik
   - Chinese: åŒ—äº¬å¤§å­¦ (Peking University)

7. SPECIAL CHARACTERS AND UNICODE:
   - Symbols: Â®, Â©, â„¢, Â§, Â¶, â€ , â€¡
   - Accented characters: cafÃ©, naÃ¯ve, rÃ©sumÃ©
   - Mathematical symbols: Î±, Î², Î³, Î”, âˆ‘, âˆ«, âˆž
   - Emoji: ðŸš€ SpaceX launches ðŸŒŸ

8. NESTED STRUCTURES:
   The AI Lab at Stanford University (part of the Department of Computer Science) 
   works with researchers from MIT's CSAIL (Computer Science and Artificial 
   Intelligence Laboratory).

9. ABBREVIATION CONFLICTS:
   - AI (Artificial Intelligence vs. Amnesty International)
   - IBM (International Business Machines vs. Intercontinental Ballistic Missile)
   - US (United States vs. "us" pronoun)

10. CONTEXTUAL DEPENDENCIES:
    John works at Apple. He enjoys eating apple pie. The Apple store sells 
    MacBooks. An apple a day keeps the doctor away.

11. INCOMPLETE OR BROKEN TEXT:
    Dr. Sarah Chen from Stanf... [text cut off]
    The company reported $47.2M in reve
    ...ord University published a paper on...

12. WHITESPACE AND FORMATTING ANOMALIES:
    Lots     of     spaces     between     words
    
    
    Multiple
    
    
    Line
    
    
    Breaks
    
    	Tabs	and	spaces	mixed	together

13. FALSE POSITIVE TRIGGERS:
    - "I am going to the store" (not "I AM" organization)  
    - "We will meet at 3:00 PM EST" (EST not a company)
    - "The document is in PDF format" (PDF not a person)

14. BOUNDARY CASES:
    - Single character names: "X Corp", "Y Combinator"
    - Very long names: "The International Federation of Association Football"
    - Names with numbers: "3M Company", "7-Eleven", "Formula 1"

15. QUOTE AND PUNCTUATION HANDLING:
    "John Smith" said, "I work at 'Tech Corp' in San Francisco."
    The paper (authored by Dr. Chen et al.) discusses AI/ML applications.

This document tests entity extraction robustness across various edge cases and challenges.
